# The `RuntimePointerChecking` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Holds information about the memory runtime legality checks to verify that a group of pointers do not overlap. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::RuntimePointerChecking</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Holds information about the memory runtime legality checks to verify that a group of pointers do not overlap.

Definition at line 457 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.

### insert() {#abe6c75313479a0d0d8dd63b870faeeac}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RuntimePointerChecking::insert (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42; Lp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; Ptr, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42; PtrExpr, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; AccessTy, bool WritePtr, unsigned DepSetId, unsigned ASId, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a> &amp; PSE, bool NeedsFreeze)</>}>
Insert a pointer and calculate the start and end SCEVs.

Calculate Start and End points of memory access using getStartAndEndForAccess.

We need <code>PSE</code> in order to compute the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expression of the pointer according to the assumptions that we&#39;ve made during the analysis. The method might also version the pointer stride according to <code>Strides</code>, and add new predicates to <code>PSE</code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00507">507</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp/#l00250">250</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp">LoopAccessAnalysis.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Private Member Functions

### generateChecks() {#a6d94d10df64770bc7fb8be204a15f004}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt; RuntimePointerCheck, 4 &gt; RuntimePointerChecking::generateChecks ()</>}>
Generate the checks and return them.

### groupChecks() {#a7f6af6c87c6754ff0bd5e625cb3c7969}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void RuntimePointerChecking::groupChecks (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker/#a4eb0c14b923c59b75a82bc41e03c2575">MemoryDepChecker::DepCandidates</a> &amp; DepCands, bool UseDependencies)</>}>
Groups pointers such that a single memcheck is required between two different groups.

This will clear the CheckingGroups vector and re-compute it. We will only group dependecies if <code>UseDependencies</code> is true, otherwise we will create a separate group for each pointer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00586">586</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp/#l00450">450</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-cpp">LoopAccessAnalysis.cpp</a>.

### tryToCreateDiffCheck() {#a5628ff315c129a4d3c8ab44482eb7db8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool RuntimePointerChecking::tryToCreateDiffCheck (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/runtimecheckingptrgroup">RuntimeCheckingPtrGroup</a> &amp; CGI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/runtimecheckingptrgroup">RuntimeCheckingPtrGroup</a> &amp; CGJ)</>}>
Try to create add a new (pointer-difference, access size) pair to DiffCheck for checking groups <code>CGI</code> and <code>CGJ</code>.

If pointer-difference checks cannot be used for the groups, set CanUseDiffCheck to false.
